21#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
22#[cfg_attr(feature = "artifact-size", derive(loupe::MemoryUsage))]
23pub struct Memory {
24    pub(crate) handle: StoreHandle<VMMemory>,
25}
26
27impl Memory {
28    pub fn new(store: &mut impl AsStoreMut, ty: MemoryType) -> Result<Self, MemoryError> {
29        let mut store = store.as_store_mut();
30        let tunables = store.engine().tunables();
31        let style = tunables.memory_style(&ty);
32        let memory = tunables.create_host_memory(&ty, &style)?;
33
34        Ok(Self {
35            handle: StoreHandle::new(store.objects_mut(), memory),
36        })
37    }
38
39    pub fn new_from_existing(new_store: &mut impl AsStoreMut, memory: VMMemory) -> Self {
40        let handle = StoreHandle::new(new_store.objects_mut(), memory);
41        Self::from_vm_extern(new_store, handle.internal_handle())
42    }
43
44    pub fn ty(&self, store: &impl AsStoreRef) -> MemoryType {
45        self.handle.get(store.as_store_ref().objects()).ty()
46    }
47
48    pub fn grow<IntoPages>(
49        &self,
50        store: &mut impl AsStoreMut,
51        delta: IntoPages,
52    ) -> Result<Pages, MemoryError>
53    where
54        IntoPages: Into<Pages>,
55    {
56        self.handle.get_mut(store.objects_mut()).grow(delta.into())
57    }
58
59    pub fn grow_at_least(
60        &self,
61        store: &mut impl AsStoreMut,
62        min_size: u64,
63    ) -> Result<(), MemoryError> {
64        self.handle
65            .get_mut(store.objects_mut())
66            .grow_at_least(min_size)
67    }
68
69    pub fn reset(&self, store: &mut impl AsStoreMut) -> Result<(), MemoryError> {
70        self.handle.get_mut(store.objects_mut()).reset()?;
71        Ok(())
72    }
73
74    pub(crate) fn from_vm_extern(store: &impl AsStoreRef, vm_extern: VMExternMemory) -> Self {
75        Self {
76            handle: unsafe {
77                StoreHandle::from_internal(store.as_store_ref().objects().id(), vm_extern)
78            },
79        }
80    }
81
82    /// Checks whether this `Memory` can be used with the given context.
83    pub fn is_from_store(&self, store: &impl AsStoreRef) -> bool {
84        self.handle.store_id() == store.as_store_ref().objects().id()
85    }
86
87    /// Cloning memory will create another reference to the same memory that
88    /// can be put into a new store
89    pub fn try_clone(&self, store: &impl AsStoreRef) -> Result<VMMemory, MemoryError> {
90        let mem = self.handle.get(store.as_store_ref().objects());
91        let cloned = mem.try_clone()?;
92        Ok(cloned.into())
93    }
94
95    /// Copying the memory will actually copy all the bytes in the memory to
96    /// a identical byte copy of the original that can be put into a new store
97    pub fn try_copy(
98        &self,
99        store: &impl AsStoreRef,
100    ) -> Result<Box<dyn LinearMemory + 'static>, MemoryError> {
101        let mut mem = self.try_clone(store)?;
102        mem.copy()
103    }
104
105    pub fn as_shared(&self, store: &impl AsStoreRef) -> Option<crate::SharedMemory> {
106        let mem = self.handle.get(store.as_store_ref().objects());
107        let conds = mem.thread_conditions()?.downgrade();
108
109        Some(crate::SharedMemory::new(crate::Memory(self.clone()), conds))
110    }
111
112    /// To `VMExtern`.
113    pub(crate) fn to_vm_extern(&self) -> VMExtern {
114        VMExtern::Memory(self.handle.internal_handle())
115    }
116}
117
118impl crate::externals::memory::SharedMemoryOps for ThreadConditionsHandle {
119    fn notify(
120        &self,
121        dst: crate::externals::memory::MemoryLocation,
122        count: u32,
123    ) -> Result<u32, crate::AtomicsError> {
124        let count = self
125            .upgrade()
126            .ok_or(crate::AtomicsError::Unimplemented)?
127            .do_notify(
128                wasmer_vm::NotifyLocation {
129                    address: dst.address,
130                },
131                count,
132            );
133        Ok(count)
134    }
135
136    fn wait(
137        &self,
138        dst: crate::externals::memory::MemoryLocation,
139        timeout: Option<std::time::Duration>,
140    ) -> Result<u32, crate::AtomicsError> {
141        self.upgrade()
142            .ok_or(crate::AtomicsError::Unimplemented)?
143            .do_wait(
144                wasmer_vm::NotifyLocation {
145                    address: dst.address,
146                },
147                timeout,
148            )
149            .map_err(|e| match e {
150                wasmer_vm::WaiterError::Unimplemented => crate::AtomicsError::Unimplemented,
151                wasmer_vm::WaiterError::TooManyWaiters => crate::AtomicsError::TooManyWaiters,
152                wasmer_vm::WaiterError::AtomicsDisabled => crate::AtomicsError::AtomicsDisabled,
153                _ => crate::AtomicsError::Unimplemented,
154            })
155    }
156
157    fn disable_atomics(&self) -> Result<(), MemoryError> {
158        self.upgrade()
159            .ok_or_else(|| MemoryError::Generic("memory was dropped".to_string()))?
160            .disable_atomics();
161        Ok(())
162    }
163
164    fn wake_all_atomic_waiters(&self) -> Result<(), MemoryError> {
165        self.upgrade()
166            .ok_or_else(|| MemoryError::Generic("memory was dropped".to_string()))?
167            .wake_all_atomic_waiters();
168        Ok(())
169    }
170}
171
172impl std::cmp::PartialEq for Memory {
173    fn eq(&self, other: &Self) -> bool {
174        self.handle == other.handle
175    }
176}

178impl std::cmp::Eq for Memory {}

180/// Underlying buffer for a memory.
181#[derive(Debug, Copy, Clone)]
182pub(crate) struct MemoryBuffer<'a> {
183    pub(crate) base: *mut u8,
184    pub(crate) len: usize,
185    pub(crate) marker: PhantomData<&'a MemoryView<'a>>,
186}
187
188impl<'a> MemoryBuffer<'a> {
189    pub(crate) fn read(&self, offset: u64, buf: &mut [u8]) -> Result<(), MemoryAccessError> {
190        let end = offset
191            .checked_add(buf.len() as u64)
192            .ok_or(MemoryAccessError::Overflow)?;
193        if end > self.len.try_into().unwrap() {
194            warn!(
195                "attempted to read ({} bytes) beyond the bounds of the memory view ({} > {})",
196                buf.len(),
197                end,
198                self.len
199            );
200            return Err(MemoryAccessError::HeapOutOfBounds);
201        }
202        unsafe {
203            volatile_memcpy_read(self.base.add(offset as usize), buf.as_mut_ptr(), buf.len());
204        }
205        Ok(())
206    }
207
208    pub(crate) fn read_uninit<'b>(
209        &self,
210        offset: u64,
211        buf: &'b mut [MaybeUninit<u8>],
212    ) -> Result<&'b mut [u8], MemoryAccessError> {
213        let end = offset
214            .checked_add(buf.len() as u64)
215            .ok_or(MemoryAccessError::Overflow)?;
216        if end > self.len.try_into().unwrap() {
217            warn!(
218                "attempted to read ({} bytes) beyond the bounds of the memory view ({} > {})",
219                buf.len(),
220                end,
221                self.len
222            );
223            return Err(MemoryAccessError::HeapOutOfBounds);
224        }
225        let buf_ptr = buf.as_mut_ptr() as *mut u8;
226        unsafe {
227            volatile_memcpy_read(self.base.add(offset as usize), buf_ptr, buf.len());
228        }
229
230        Ok(unsafe { slice::from_raw_parts_mut(buf_ptr, buf.len()) })
231    }
232
233    pub(crate) fn write(&self, offset: u64, data: &[u8]) -> Result<(), MemoryAccessError> {
234        let end = offset
235            .checked_add(data.len() as u64)
236            .ok_or(MemoryAccessError::Overflow)?;
237        if end > self.len.try_into().unwrap() {
238            warn!(
239                "attempted to write ({} bytes) beyond the bounds of the memory view ({} > {})",
240                data.len(),
241                end,
242                self.len
243            );
244            return Err(MemoryAccessError::HeapOutOfBounds);
245        }
246        unsafe {
247            volatile_memcpy_write(data.as_ptr(), self.base.add(offset as usize), data.len());
248        }
249        Ok(())
250    }
251}
252
253// We can't use a normal memcpy here because it has undefined behavior if the
254// memory is being concurrently modified. So we need to write our own memcpy
255// implementation which uses volatile operations.
256//
257// The implementation of these functions can optimize very well when inlined
258// with a fixed length: they should compile down to a single load/store
259// instruction for small (8/16/32/64-bit) copies.
260#[inline]
261unsafe fn volatile_memcpy_read(mut src: *const u8, mut dst: *mut u8, mut len: usize) {
262    #[inline]
263    unsafe fn copy_one<T>(src: &mut *const u8, dst: &mut *mut u8, len: &mut usize) {
264        #[repr(packed)]
265        struct Unaligned<T>(T);
266        let val = (*src as *const Unaligned<T>).read_volatile();
267        (*dst as *mut Unaligned<T>).write(val);
268        *src = src.add(mem::size_of::<T>());
269        *dst = dst.add(mem::size_of::<T>());
270        *len -= mem::size_of::<T>();
271    }
272
273    while len >= 8 {
274        copy_one::<u64>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
275    }
276    if len >= 4 {
277        copy_one::<u32>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
278    }
279    if len >= 2 {
280        copy_one::<u16>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
281    }
282    if len >= 1 {
283        copy_one::<u8>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
284    }
285}
286#[inline]
287unsafe fn volatile_memcpy_write(mut src: *const u8, mut dst: *mut u8, mut len: usize) {
288    #[inline]
289    unsafe fn copy_one<T>(src: &mut *const u8, dst: &mut *mut u8, len: &mut usize) {
290        #[repr(packed)]
291        struct Unaligned<T>(T);
292        let val = (*src as *const Unaligned<T>).read();
293        (*dst as *mut Unaligned<T>).write_volatile(val);
294        *src = src.add(mem::size_of::<T>());
295        *dst = dst.add(mem::size_of::<T>());
296        *len -= mem::size_of::<T>();
297    }
298
299    while len >= 8 {
300        copy_one::<u64>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
301    }
302    if len >= 4 {
303        copy_one::<u32>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
304    }
305    if len >= 2 {
306        copy_one::<u16>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
307    }
308    if len >= 1 {
309        copy_one::<u8>(&mut src, &mut dst, &mut len);
310    }
311}
